episodes.title: I Debated Michael Knowles on Jubilee - Yes, Gay Marriage CAN Exist - DEBUNKING Bad Conservative Philosophy
episodes.description: In this video, I break down my debate with Michael Knowles on Jubilee about the topic of same-sex marriage, philosophy, and conservative ideology. We go deep into metaphysics, logic, and how anti-LGBT arguments are structured to sound airtight—but fall apart under scrutiny. Michael and I come from the same religious movement, and I used to believe the same things he argues today. But as I studied philosophy and deconstructed my faith, I realized just how flimsy these arguments are. Stick with me as we explore nominalism vs. realism, the Texas sharpshooter fallacy, and why Michael’s claims on metaphysical reality don’t hold up. This video will equip you to counter these arguments in everyday conversations and protect our rights from bad-faith actors. 00:00 - Introduction: My Debate with Michael Knowles 02:30 - The Core Argument: Does Gay Marriage Exist? 06:45 - Michael’s First Mistake: The Realism vs. Nominalism Trap 11:20 - The Texas Sharpshooter Fallacy: Cherry-Picking History 15:55 - Why Metaphysics Can’t Define Legal Marriage 21:10 - The Logical Impossibility Fallacy (And Why It’s B.S.) 26:40 - Why Michael’s Argument is Ultimately Religious, Not Logical 32:15 - Final Thoughts: How to Counter These Arguments IRL To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: The WEIRD Reason The Catholic Church Wants To Control Your Sex Life -  Trent Horn  Debunked
episodes.description: Catholic apologist Trent Horn recently posted a video titled "The Sex Questions Almost No One Can Answer", where he attempts to justify Catholic sexual ethics using Natural Law philosophy. But are these arguments sound? Join my discord for $1/m: patreon.com/c/gayextrad As a former devout Catholic and apologist, I break down the flaws in this ideology and show how these outdated beliefs impact real people—through shame, control, and even political legislation. From ‘intrinsic evils’ to absurd rules on contraception, let's talk about why these arguments don't hold up and why you don’t have to buy into them. If you enjoy this content and want to support my work, join my Patreon for exclusive access to my Discord community of ex-Catholics, queer folks, and free thinkers. Let's have these conversations where they matter. Patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad Podcast: Intrinsically Ordered (Available on all major platforms) Socials: @GayExTrad 00:00 - A Catholic Apologist's "Unanswerable" Sex Question 01:35 - Why Non-Catholics Should Care 02:23 - The Weird Catholic Obsession with Sex 04:09 - Does Feeling Disgusted = Morally Wrong? 06:42 - The Catholic “Natural Law” Scam 08:32 - The Ethics of Consent vs. Catholic Control 11:07 - The Debate Trick Catholics Always Use 14:22 - Catholic Sexual Rules Are Wild 18:07 - Sex, Marriage & Fertility: The Catholic Hypocrisy 23:35 - The Rise of Catholic Theocracy in Politics 29:18 - Leaving Catholicism & Finding Freedom To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: Finding Meaning Without God: Running A Thousand Miles, Secular Buddhism, Addiction, and Trauma
episodes.description: In this episode of Intrinsically Ordered, I sit down with Jason—a long-time friend, ultramarathoner, and secular Buddhist—to explore life beyond dogma. We dive deep into questions of meaning, suffering, and personal transformation. Jason shares his journey from childhood trauma, addiction, and depression to healing, self-acceptance, and the liberating philosophy of secular Buddhism. We tackle the fear of leaving behind rigid belief systems, the reality of self-imposed suffering, and the beauty of finding your own path. Whether you’re deconstructing faith, seeking purpose, or just curious about running 200+ miles through the wilderness, this conversation is for you. 🔹 The illusion of certainty in religion 🔹 What it really means to "find yourself" 🔹 The power of suffering as a teacher 🔹 Ultramarathons as a metaphor for life 🔹 Reframing trauma and choosing a new narrative If you’ve ever questioned what’s next after faith—or just want to hear an incredible journey of resilience—this episode is a must-listen. Timestamps: 00:00 – Introduction & Guest Introduction 01:18 – Why People Fear Leaving Religion 03:06 – What If Life Has No Meaning? 05:00 – Creating Meaning vs. Finding It 10:59 – The Role of Suffering in Growth 15:31 – How Religion Becomes a Coping Mechanism 17:30 – Hitting Rock Bottom: Alcoholism & Trauma 22:40 – Running From Pain vs. Facing It 29:09 – The Turning Point: Therapy & Healing 33:56 – How Trauma Affects the Brain 40:17 – The Difference Between Pain & Suffering 41:44 – Living in the Present: The Power of Mindfulness 47:10 – What Therapy is REALLY Like 50:48 – Running 250 Miles—Why Choose to Suffer? 54:55 – The Mental Side of Ultra-Endurance 59:46 – The Freedom of Letting Go 1:04:05 – Choosing Your Own Path & Building Community 1:10:22 – Finding Belonging Outside of Religion 1:12:03 – How to Start Living YOUR Life Today 1:28:18 – Final Thoughts & Takeaways To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: 'just STOP being gay' - chastity speaker's desperate plea to end gay marriage (Jason Evert)
episodes.description: What if you're gay but don't want to be gay? Jason Evert has the perfect solution, just hate yourself. He gives us a 'third option' to homosexuality where you can hate yourself, but publicly. Someone please patent this man's genius methods and scientific tests of what marriage must include. But in all seriousness, Jason Evert is the Final Boss of catholic apologists who do nothing but create word salads to confuse people and pad church teaching. He's the one that started me down the catholic rabbit-hole of chastity speakers & how to deal with SSA, so I figured I'd give a humorous response to his Ascension Presents video. episodes.description:

episodes.title: 'CHAIRS prove being gay is a SIN' - crazy pastor's terrible arguments (Father Mike Schmitz)
episodes.description: Father Mike Schmitz (celebrity catholic priest) uses chairs to demonstrate teleology, and then makes anti-gay arguments from Theology of the Body. This approach fails in so many ways, and I don't think chairs are our best proof of teleology. I (a gay ex-traditional catholic apologist) give my reaction to his wild takes on teleology. This is the talk that convinced me when I was much younger to not be gay, so I figured I'd be fun to start my video-essays with an emotional reaction to his talk. 00:00-01:12 - intro 01:12-03:35 - don’t violate the nature of things 03:35-04:44 - sex is only for procreation 06:44-08:44 - his brother came out as gay 08:44-10:33 - settle with just being friends 10:33-11:45 - just be happy 11:46-12:25 - my thoughts as a gay ex-catholic To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: Debunking the Catholic Church's Anti-Contraception Philosophy
episodes.description: Let's dive deep into the Catholic Church's controversial teaching on contraception, its roots in outdated philosophies, and the societal impact of enforcing such dogma. From Humanae Vitae to the rise of "Theology of the Body," we'll critically examine how these doctrines shape attitudes toward birth control, women's rights, and personal autonomy. With years of theological study and firsthand experience within the Church, I explore why these teachings don't hold up under scrutiny—and why they're dangerous. Let's discuss how these views connect to the broader right-wing war on contraception and personal freedom. 00:00 - The Catholic Church’s Most Oppressive Document 01:05 - The Church’s Official Teaching on Birth Control 02:04 - Why Non-Catholics Should Care 03:03 - The Philosophy of Natural Law 05:51 - Debunking Natural Law 07:23 - Theology of the Body 10:00 - Scare Tactics and Misinformation 13:35 - The Church vs. Birth Control Science 15:48 - Natural Family Planning (NFP) 19:37 - The Global Consequences of Church Policy 21:42 - The Real Reason Behind Church Teachings 25:05 - The Hypocrisy of Church Leaders 27:30 - Empowerment Through Choice 29:33 - Closing Thoughts and Call to Action To join our discord community for $1 or to support my work/get early access to content, check out my patreon: https://www.patreon.com/c/gayextrad To be a guest on the episode, visit my YT channel and send me an email.

episodes.title: Brandon Robertson: Deconstructing Christianity & How to Joining the Queer Community
episodes.description:
Join us as we dive deep with Brandon Robertson, a leading voice in progressive Christianity, to explore the intersection of faith, identity, and sexuality. From his journey out of evangelicalism to becoming a queer pastor and theologian, Brandon shares his challenges, insights, and the liberating message of his new book, Queer and Christian. Whether you're deconstructing your faith or seeking new perspectives, this episode will inspire and challenge your thinking.

To pre-order Brandon's book and connect with his work, visit http://queerchristian.org/.

Whether you're curious about independent Catholicism, searching for spiritual connection, or inspired by stories of resilience, this episode offers deep insights and heartfelt conversations.

episodes.description:

This is a story of courage, resilience, and the pursuit of truth.

Yes, this video is directly attacking church teaching and is quite condescending. Why? This teaching, more than almost any other, destroys peoples' lives and takes away peoples' rights. I'm a fan of people choosing religious beliefs that work for them, but this realm is perhaps one of the worst parts of catholicism. Hence, the forceful speaking out. episodes.title: Answering Trent Horn's 'Questions Liberals Can't Answer' - Non-Catholic Answers Ep 1
episodes.description: Trent Horn, a catholic apologist for Catholic Answers and host of the Counsel of Trent show, published a talk recently at Young Americans for Freedom called '7 Questions Liberals Can't Answer.' I hopped on a call with Veronica from the Leave Laugh Love podcast and my two friends Ben & Colin to respond to some of Trent's questions on socialism, gay marriage, contraception, transgenderism, MAID, and abortion. Myself and co-host in this episode are all ex-catholic is varying degrees. All opinions are each individual's own (including my own crazy takes). To join the show on a future episode or submit content for us to react to, shoot me an email (available on my YT channel) or Patreon. To support this work in fighting radical catholicism, get early access to episodes, and join my discord of ex/current catholics, consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad

episodes.title: Being a Queer Woman of Color in Traditional Catholicism & Using Witchcraft to Heal: Therese's Story
episodes.description: Therese was born into a FSSP parish. She has many good memories, but also many bad memories from her time: an overbearing mother, purity culture, being in the closet, and catholic dating. But now, Therese is living her best life after deconstructing - experiencing the world, practicing witchcraft, and falling in love. Today, Colin and I sat down with Therese to hear her story and thoughts on life. It was an honor getting to hear her story. To join our community of ex/current catholics, get early access to videos, and support this work, consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad. If you'd like to be on the show, please email me - contact info on my YT channel. I'd love to hear your story and thoughts on the world!

episodes.title: Queer Folks Are a Danger to the Catholic Church's 'Infallible' Magisterium
episodes.description: The Catholic Church promises 'true peace' to all who follow Him, but what do you do when you don't? What if your existence and wellbeing run contrary to this path that contains the 'fullness of the truth?' Today, I had a longer discussion with my friend Colin (gay, raised FSSP) and Astronaut (gay, former cleric) about my last video 'The Catholic Church Doesn't Know What to Do With Gay People.' The Intrinsically Ordered Podcast is available on all major podcast platforms and explores the intersection of queer identity and catholicism - sharing stories of those who've left, remained, and created their own journeys; providing commentary on the catholic church's harmful teachings; helping those who've been hurt. To get early access to new episodes, submit questions to guests, and support this work, consider supporting me on patreon: patreon.com/c/gayextrad 00:02:00 - Queer Identity and the Church's Structure 00:10:00 - Emotional Impact of Catholicism 00:33:27 - Gay Priests 00:44:12 - Intimacy & Sexuality 00:52:32 - Philosophical Dilemmas 01:02:35 - Navigating Logic Mazes in Theology 01:12:02 - Should You Stay Catholic To be a guest on the show or to contact, email can be found in channel information

episodes.title: Why I Stay Catholic as a Gay Man - Chris Dowling-Magill Interview
episodes.description: I sat down with Chris Dowling to hear his story of loosing his job after coming out, why he still stays religious, how he lives out of the fruits of the spirit, and his upcoming two-year anniversary of being married. To connect with Chris and hear more of his work, make sure to follow him on Instagram and Facebook. To support interviews like this, consider supporting my work on Patreon and gain early access to new episodes: patreon.com/gaytradspeaks. I have Simon Kent Fung (creator of Dear Alana), Justin ('EmptyChairsHome' on social media), and a number of other guests lined up to be on the podcast. The goal of this podcast format is to to hear stories of people at the intersection of queer identity and religion. I've shared plenty about my story and my own thoughts on my main channel, but I wanted to create a second channel dedicated to hearing others' stories - remaining in the church, leaving the church, finding a more accepting denomination, etc. Hopefully these stories can give you more of a perspective and help you make decisions for your faith journey. If you'd like to be on the podcast, feel free to reach out - contact info is on my channel, or send me a DM.
